intro: Scaphyglottis wercklei var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered scaphyglottis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces large, butterfly-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
